block.field: I set black blocks to appear at first, allowing me to just 'chisel out' the letter of a 5x7 brick. This makes it easier to adjust on the fly, much more so than creating lettering using the black bricks
I simply copied the As and altered the colors and heights.

During this project, I tried to make the code as simple as possible by reducing the amount of bricks used. The most complex letter was probably the G, with 3 bricks of all different sizes. Some of the letters do suffer a bit from the simple style, but most people will still recognize letters like the B at the end of Jakob.
Letters are set to the offset, allowing for me to just need to change the height. This could've been improved by changing the offset for the height though.
